00058   //  ====================  ProModel  ======================
00059 
00060   //    This class is a virtue needed only for defining certain
00061   // functions of Model, which are used by Chain and
00062   // Residue
00063 
00064   DefineClass(ProModel);
00065   DefineStreamFunctions(ProModel);
00066 
00067   DefineClass(Manager);
00068 
00069   class ProModel : public UDData  {
00070 
00071     friend class Chain;
00072 
00073     public :
00074 
00075       ProModel  () : UDData () {}
00076       ProModel  ( io::RPStream Object ) : UDData ( Object ) {}
00077       ~ProModel () {}
00078 
00079       virtual cpstr GetEntryID () { return ""; }
00080       virtual void  SetEntryID ( const IDCode ) {}
00081 
00082       virtual int   AddChain ( PChain ) { return 0; }
00083 
00084       // returns pointer to Root
00085       virtual PManager GetCoordHierarchy() { return NULL; }
00086 
00087       //  GetNumberOfModels() returns TOTAL number of models
00088       virtual int GetNumberOfModels() { return 0;    }
00089 
00090       //  GetNumberOfAllAtoms() returns TOTAL number of atoms in
00091       // all models
00092       virtual int GetNumberOfAllAtoms() { return 0;    }
00093 
00094       //  returns pointer to the general Atom array
00095       virtual PPAtom     GetAllAtoms() { return NULL; }
00096 
00097       virtual int  GetSerNum       () { return 0; }
00098 
00099       virtual void ExpandAtomArray ( int )  {}
00100       virtual void AddAtomArray    ( int )  {}
00101 
00102     protected :
00103 
00104       virtual int  _ExcludeChain ( const ChainID ) { return 0; }
00105 
00106   };

00169   class DBReference : public ContainerChain  {
00170 
00171     public :
00172 
00173       int      seqBeg;      // initial seq num of the PDB seq-ce segment
00174       InsCode  insBeg;      // initial ins code of the PDB seq-ce segm-t
00175       int      seqEnd;      // ending seq number of the PDB seq-ce segm-t
00176       InsCode  insEnd;      // ending ins code of the PDB seq-ce segment
00177       DBName   database;    // sequence database name
00178       DBAcCode dbAccession; // sequence database accession code
00179       DBIdCode dbIdCode;    // sequence database identification code
00180       int      dbseqBeg;    // initial seq number of the database segment
00181       InsCode  dbinsBeg;    // ins code of initial residue of the segment
00182       int      dbseqEnd;    // ending seq number of the database segment
00183       InsCode  dbinsEnd;   // ins code of the ending residue of the seg-t
00184 
00185       DBReference ();
00186       DBReference ( PChain Chain_Owner );
00187       DBReference ( PChain Chain_Owner, cpstr S );
00188       DBReference ( io::RPStream Object );
00189       ~DBReference();
00190 
00191       void       PDBASCIIDump    ( pstr S, int N );
00192       void       MakeCIF         ( mmcif::PData CIF, int N );
00193       ERROR_CODE ConvertPDBASCII ( cpstr S );
00194       ERROR_CODE GetCIF          ( mmcif::PData CIF, int & n );
00195       CLASS_ID   GetClassID      () { return ClassID_DBReference; }
00196 
00197       void  Copy  ( PContainerClass DBRef );
00198 
00199       void  write ( io::RFile f );
00200       void  read  ( io::RFile f );
00201 
00202     protected :
00203 
00204       void InitDBReference();
00205 
00206   };

00372   //  =================  Chain  =======================
00373 
00374   DefineFactoryFunctions(Chain);
00375 
00376   class Chain : public UDData  {
00377 
00378     friend class DBReference;
00379     friend class SeqAdv;
00380     friend class SeqRes;
00381     friend class ModRes;
00382     friend class HetRec;
00383     friend class Residue;
00384     friend class Atom;
00385     friend class Model;
00386     friend class Root;
00387     friend class SelManager;
00388     friend class BondManager;
00389     friend class CoorManager;
00390     friend class Manager;
00391 
00392     public :
00393 
00394       ChainContainer DBRef;    // database reference
00395       ChainContainer seqAdv;   // SEQADV records
00396       SeqRes         seqRes;   // Sequence residues, SEQRES records
00397       ChainContainer modRes;   // modification descriptions
00398       ChainContainer Het;      // non-standard residues descriptions
00399 
00400       Chain ();  // SetModel() MUST be used after this constructor!
00401       Chain ( PProModel model, const ChainID chID );
00402       Chain ( io::RPStream Object );
00403       ~Chain();
00404 
00405       void FreeAnnotations();
00406 
00407       void SetModel ( PProModel    model );
00408       void SetChain ( const ChainID chID );
00409 
00410       PManager GetCoordHierarchy();   // PRoot
00411 
00412       //   ConvertXXXXX(..) functions do not check for record name
00413       // and assume that PDBString is at least 81 symbols long
00414       // (including the terminating null).
00415       ERROR_CODE ConvertDBREF  ( cpstr PDBString );
00416       ERROR_CODE ConvertSEQADV ( cpstr PDBString );
00417       ERROR_CODE ConvertSEQRES ( cpstr PDBString );
00418       ERROR_CODE ConvertMODRES ( cpstr PDBString );
00419       ERROR_CODE ConvertHET    ( cpstr PDBString );
00420 
00421       // This function should be used for testing purposes only.
00422       // A full PDB ASCII dump for all models and chains involved
00423       // is done by Root class.
00424       void  PDBASCIIDump     ( io::RFile f );
00425 
00426       void  PDBASCIIAtomDump ( io::RFile f );
00427       void  MakeAtomCIF      ( mmcif::PData CIF );
00428 
00429 
00430       //  -----------------  Extracting residues  -------------------------
00431 
00432       int GetNumberOfResidues(); // returns number of res-s in the chain
00433       PResidue GetResidue ( int resNo );  // returns resNo-th residue
00434                                           // in the chain;
00435                                           // 0<=resNo<nResidues
00436 
00437       //   GetResidue(..) returns pointer on residue, whose sequence
00438       // number and insert code are given in seqNum and insCode,
00439       // respectively. If such a residue is absent in the chain,
00440       // returns NULL.
00441       PResidue GetResidue ( int seqNum, const InsCode insCode );
00442 
00443       //   GetResidueNo(..) returns the residue number in the chain's
00444       // residues table. Residues are numbered as 0..nres-1 as they
00445       // appear in the coordinate file.
00446       //   If residue is not found, the function returns -1.
00447       int  GetResidueNo ( int seqNum, const InsCode insCode );
00448 
00449       void GetResidueTable ( PPResidue & resTable,
00450                              int & NumberOfResidues );
00451 
00452       //   GetResidueCreate(..) returns pointer on residue, whose name,
00453       // sequence number and insertion code are given by resName, seqNum
00454       // and insCode, respectively. If such a residue is absent in the
00455       // chain, one is created at the end of chain.
00456       //   If a residue with given sequence number and insertion code
00457       // is present in the chain but has a different name, the function
00458       // returns NULL unless Enforce is set True. In the latter case,
00459       // a new residue is still created at the end of chain, but there
00460       // is no guarantee that any function operating on the sequence
00461       // number and insertion code will work properly.
00462       PResidue GetResidueCreate ( const ResName resName, int seqNum,
00463                                   const InsCode insCode, bool Enforce );
00464 
00465 
00466       //  ------------------  Deleting residues  ----------------------
00467 
00468       int  DeleteResidue ( int resNo ); // returns num of deleted res-s
00469       int  DeleteResidue ( int seqNum, const InsCode insCode );
00470       int  DeleteAllResidues();
00471       int  DeleteSolvent    ();
00472       void TrimResidueTable ();  // do not forget to call after all dels
00473 
00474       //  -------------------  Adding residues  -----------------------
00475 
00476       //   AddResidue(..) adds residue to the chain, InsResidue inserts
00477       // the residue on the specified position of the chain (other
00478       // residues are shifted up to the end of chain). Position in the
00479       // chain may be specified by a serial number (that is position in
00480       // the residue table) or by seqNum and insCode of one of the
00481       // chain's residues (the new residue is then inserted before that
00482       // one). If the chain is associated with a coordinate hierarchy,
00483       // and residue 'res' is not, the latter is checked in
00484       // automatically. If residue 'res' belongs to any coordinate
00485       // hierarchy (even though that of the residue), it is *copied*
00486       // rather than simply taken over, and is checked in.
00487       //   If the chain is not associated with a coordinate hierarchy,
00488       // all added residues will be checked in automatically once the
00489       // chain is checked in.
00490       int  AddResidue ( PResidue res );
00491       int  InsResidue ( PResidue res, int pos );
00492       int  InsResidue ( PResidue res, int seqNum, const InsCode insCode );
00493 
00494       //  --------------------  Extracting atoms  ---------------------
00495 
00496       int  GetNumberOfAtoms ( bool countTers );
00497       int  GetNumberOfAtoms ( int seqNo, const InsCode insCode );
00498       int  GetNumberOfAtoms ( int resNo );
00499 
00500       PAtom GetAtom ( int            seqNo,
00501                       const InsCode  insCode,
00502                       const AtomName aname,
00503                       const Element  elmnt,
00504                       const AltLoc   aloc );
00505       PAtom GetAtom ( int seqNo, const InsCode insCode, int atomNo );
00506       PAtom GetAtom ( int            resNo,
00507                       const AtomName aname,
00508                       const Element  elmnt,
00509                       const AltLoc   aloc );
00510       PAtom GetAtom ( int resNo, int atomNo );
00511 
00512       void GetAtomTable ( int seqNo, const InsCode insCode,
00513                           PPAtom & atomTable, int & NumberOfAtoms );
00514       void GetAtomTable ( int resNo,
00515                           PPAtom & atomTable, int & NumberOfAtoms );
00516 
00517       //   GetAtomTable1(..) returns atom table without TER atoms and
00518       // without NULL atom pointers. NumberOfAtoms returns the actual
00519       // number of atom pointers in atomTable.
00520       //   atomTable is allocated withing the function. If it was
00521       // not set to NULL before calling the function, the latter will
00522       // attempt to deallocate it first.
00523       //   The application is responsible for deleting atomTable,
00524       // however it must not touch atom pointers, i.e. use simply
00525       // "delete[] atomTable;". Never pass atomTable from
00526       // GetAtomTable(..) into this function, unless you set it to NULL
00527       // before doing that.
00528       void GetAtomTable1 ( int seqNo, const InsCode insCode,
00529                            PPAtom & atomTable, int & NumberOfAtoms );
00530       void GetAtomTable1 ( int resNo,
00531                            PPAtom & atomTable, int & NumberOfAtoms );
00532 
00533       //  ---------------------  Deleting atoms  ----------------------
00534 
00535       int DeleteAtom ( int            seqNo,
00536                        const InsCode  insCode,
00537                        const AtomName aname,
00538                        const Element  elmnt,
00539                        const AltLoc   aloc );
00540       int DeleteAtom ( int            seqNo,
00541                        const InsCode  insCode,
00542                        int            atomNo );
00543       int DeleteAtom ( int            resNo,
00544                        const AtomName aname,
00545                        const Element  elmnt,
00546                        const AltLoc   aloc );
00547       int DeleteAtom ( int resNo, int atomNo );
00548 
00549       int DeleteAllAtoms ( int seqNo, const InsCode insCode );
00550       int DeleteAllAtoms ( int resNo );
00551       int DeleteAllAtoms ();
00552 
00553       //  DeleteAltLocs() leaves only alternative location with maximal
00554       // occupancy, if those are equal or unspecified, the one with
00555       // "least" alternative location indicator.
00556       //  The function returns the number of deleted. All tables remain
00557       // untrimmed, so that explicit trimming or calling
00558       // FinishStructEdit() is required.
00559       int DeleteAltLocs();
00560 
00561       //  ----------------------  Adding atoms  -----------------------
00562 
00563       int AddAtom ( int seqNo, const InsCode insCode, PAtom atom );
00564       int AddAtom ( int resNo, PAtom atom );
00565 
00566       //  -------------------------------------------------------------
00567 
00568       void  ApplyTransform ( mat44 & TMatrix );  // transforms all
00569                                            // coordinates by multiplying
00570                                            // with matrix TMatrix
00571 
00572       int    GetModelNum();
00573       PModel GetModel () { return (PModel)model; }
00574       cpstr  GetChainID () { return chainID; }
00575       void   SetChainID ( const ChainID chID );
00576       cpstr  GetChainID ( pstr  ChID );  // returns /m/c
00577 
00578       void  GetAtomStatistics ( RAtomStat AS );
00579       void  CalAtomStatistics ( RAtomStat AS );
00580 
00581       int   CheckID    ( const ChainID chID );
00582       int   CheckIDS   ( cpstr CID  );
00583 
00584       cpstr GetEntryID ();
00585       void  SetEntryID ( const IDCode idCode );
00586 
00587       int   GetNumberOfDBRefs ();
00588       PDBReference  GetDBRef ( int dbRefNo );  // 0..nDBRefs-1
00589 
00590       void  MaskAtoms      ( PMask Mask );
00591       void  MaskResidues   ( PMask Mask );
00592       void  UnmaskAtoms    ( PMask Mask );
00593       void  UnmaskResidues ( PMask Mask );
00594 
00595       void  SortResidues   ();
00596 
00597       int      GetNofModResidues();
00598       PModRes  GetModResidue    ( int modResNo );  // 0.. on
00599 
00600       bool   isSolventChain   ();
00601       bool   isInSelection    ( int selHnd );
00602       bool   isAminoacidChain ();
00603       bool   isNucleotideChain();
00604 
00605 
00606       // -------  user-defined data handlers
00607       int   PutUDData ( int UDDhandle, int      iudd );
00608       int   PutUDData ( int UDDhandle, realtype rudd );
00609       int   PutUDData ( int UDDhandle, cpstr    sudd );
00610 
00611       int   GetUDData ( int UDDhandle, int      & iudd );
00612       int   GetUDData ( int UDDhandle, realtype & rudd );
00613       int   GetUDData ( int UDDhandle, pstr sudd, int maxLen );
00614       int   GetUDData ( int UDDhandle, pstr     & sudd );
00615 
00616       void  Copy            ( PChain chain );
00617       void  CopyAnnotations ( PChain chain );
00618 
00619       void  write ( io::RFile f );    // writes header to PDB binary file
00620       void  read  ( io::RFile f );    // reads header from PDB binary file
00621 
00622     protected :
00623 
00624       ChainID    chainID;     // chain ID
00625       ChainID    prevChainID; // if chain is renamed, its original
00626                               // name may be saved here.
00627       PProModel  model;       // pointer to model class
00628 
00629       int        nWeights;    // used externally for sorting
00630       realtype   Weight;      //   chains
00631 
00632       int        nResidues;   // number of residues
00633       PPResidue  residue;     // array of residues
00634 
00635       bool       Exclude;     // used internally
00636 
00637       void  InitChain ();
00638       void  FreeMemory();
00639 
00640       void  ExpandResidueArray ( int inc );
00641       //   _ExcludeResidue(..) excludes (but does not dispose!) a residue
00642       // from the chain. Returns 1 if the chain gets empty and 0
00643       // otherwise.
00644       int   _ExcludeResidue ( const ResName resName, int seqNum,
00645                               const InsCode insCode );
00646       void  _copy ( PChain chain );
00647       void  _copy ( PChain chain, PPAtom atom, int & atom_index );
00648       void  CheckInAtoms();
00649 
00650     private :
00651       int  resLen;      // length of Residue array
00652 
00653   };
